svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
November 30, 2024" date: "2024-11-29"
Eth News and Links
Tornado Cash contracts canâ€™t be sanctioned under current law, blob increase included in
Pectra upgrade and Ethereum protocol attackathon
Eth R&D protocol call (All Core Devs)
* Consensus layer focused protocol call (ACDC #146): Pectra upgrade: Mekong testnet :
consensus layer client teams fixing deposit processing bug Blobs: Agreed to increase
blobs per block target to 6 & max of 9 and change update fraction via EIP7691 Long
range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked by bandwidth Block arrival & home
staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9 (target/max) Blob fee market discussion
EIP7623 (increase calldata cost): inclusion in Pectra to be decided at execution layer
call (ACDE) next week Pectra-devnet-5 spec : agreed to exclude empty requests in Engine
API to mirror EIP7685 & consolidation processing fix in EIP7251 EIP7805 Fork-choice
enforced Inclusion Lists (FOCIL) presentation All Core Devs process improvements
* Pectra upgrade: Mekong testnet : consensus layer client teams fixing deposit
processing bug Blobs: Agreed to increase blobs per block target to 6 & max of 9 and
change update fraction via EIP7691 Long range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked
by bandwidth Block arrival & home staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9
(target/max) Blob fee market discussion EIP7623 (increase calldata cost): inclusion in
Pectra to be decided at execution layer call (ACDE) next week Pectra-devnet-5 spec :
agreed to exclude empty requests in Engine API to mirror EIP7685 & consolidation
processing fix in EIP7251
Pectra upgrade:
* Mekong testnet : consensus layer client teams fixing deposit processing bug
Mekong testnet : consensus layer client teams fixing deposit processing bug
* Blobs: Agreed to increase blobs per block target to 6 & max of 9 and change update
fraction via EIP7691 Long range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked by bandwidth
Block arrival & home staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9 (target/max) Blob
fee market discussion EIP7623 (increase calldata cost): inclusion in Pectra to be
decided at execution layer call (ACDE) next week
Blobs:
* Agreed to increase blobs per block target to 6 & max of 9 and change update fraction
via EIP7691 Long range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked by bandwidth Block
arrival & home staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9 (target/max)
Agreed to increase blobs per block target to 6 & max of 9 and change update fraction
via EIP7691
* Long range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked by bandwidth
Long range syncing , clients not purely bottlenecked by bandwidth
* Block arrival & home staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9 (target/max)
Block arrival & home staker analysis supports increase to 4/8 or 6/9 (target/max)
* Blob fee market discussion
Blob fee market discussion
* EIP7623 (increase calldata cost): inclusion in Pectra to be decided at execution
layer call (ACDE) next week
call (ACDE) next week
* Pectra-devnet-5 spec : agreed to exclude empty requests in Engine API to mirror
EIP7685 & consolidation processing fix in EIP7251
Pectra-devnet-5 spec : agreed to exclude empty requests in Engine API to mirror EIP7685
& consolidation processing fix in EIP7251
* EIP7805 Fork-choice enforced Inclusion Lists (FOCIL) presentation
EIP7805 Fork-choice enforced Inclusion Lists (FOCIL) presentation
* All Core Devs process improvements
All Core Devs process improvements
Fusaka (Osaka + Fulu) upgrade
* PeerDAS breakout #12 : spec discussions on decoupling subnets and validator custody
PeerDAS breakout #12 : spec discussions on decoupling subnets and validator custody
* EOF implementers call #62 : discussions on compiler metadata and EOFCREATE hash
EOF implementers call #62 : discussions on compiler metadata and EOFCREATE hash
Layer 1
* QUIC support : ~42% of nodes, majority running Lighthouse & mostly over IPv4
QUIC support : ~42% of nodes, majority running Lighthouse & mostly over IPv4
* BuilderNet : block building network running on TEEs, shares MEV with users, early
version live operated by Flashbots, Beaverbuild & Nethermind
BuilderNet : block building network running on TEEs, shares MEV with users, early
* Terence: same slot vs next slot for inclusion list design, spec & prototype will use
same slot
Terence: same slot vs next slot for inclusion list design, spec & prototype will use
For stakers
* Deposit tools vulnerability : multiple keystore files generated in a single run
should be considered as unencrypted
Research
* In-protocol transaction ordering , extension to Fork-Choice enforced Inclusion Lists
(FOCIL)
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.1% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.1% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~43% & Nethermind
~36% (estimate based on 74% self reported data) Consensus layer: Prysm 35% Any client
bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~43% & Nethermind ~36% (estimate based on 74% self reported
data)
Execution layer: Geth ~43% & Nethermind ~36% (estimate based on 74% self reported data)
* Consensus layer: Prysm 35%
Consensus layer: Prysm 35%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.23.1 : fixes for issues in recent devnets
* Lodestar v1.23.1 : fixes for issues in recent devnets
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7825 : Transaction gas limit cap
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* EIP7825 : Transaction gas limit cap
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7826 : Quantum supremacy bounty ERC7827 : JSON contract
with value version control ERC7828 : Chain-specific addresses using ENS ERC7829 : Data
asset NFT
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7826 : Quantum supremacy bounty
ERC7826 : Quantum supremacy bounty
* ERC7827 : JSON contract with value version control
ERC7827 : JSON contract with value version control
* ERC7828 : Chain-specific addresses using ENS
ERC7828 : Chain-specific addresses using ENS
* ERC7829 : Data asset NFT
ERC7829 : Data asset NFT
Stuff for developers
* Foundry compiler profiles : compile contracts needing optimization with IR & tests
without IR; 10x compile time reduction for Uniswap v4 contracts
Foundry compiler profiles : compile contracts needing optimization with IR & tests
* Echidna trace parser : convert Echidna call traces into Foundry tests
Echidna trace parser : convert Echidna call traces into Foundry tests
* Uniswap Compact (Solidity): ownerless ERC6909 contract, facilitates
formation/dissolution of reusable resource locks
Uniswap Compact (Solidity): ownerless ERC6909 contract, facilitates
* MicroStable : simple stablecoin design in Solidity & Vyper
MicroStable : simple stablecoin design in Solidity & Vyper
* Cyfrin Upgrade beginner & intermediate Python & Vyper courses
Cyfrin Upgrade beginner & intermediate Python & Vyper courses
* CTFs: OSAKA : EVM Object Format (EOF) challenge
CTFs:
* OSAKA : EVM Object Format (EOF) challenge
* Drift : write cached contract calls for web3 libraries (viem, web3.js & ethers)
Drift : write cached contract calls for web3 libraries (viem, web3.js & ethers)
Security
* Ethereum protocol attackathon : $1.5M reward pool, January 20 deadline
Job Listings
* Nethermind: AI Agent , Infra , Blockchain , Full Stack , BizDev & Researcher
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 4.0 to 46.4 gwei, 11.2 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 24.2 gwei 9.5k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 4.0 to 46.4 gwei, 11.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.2 gwei
Gas: 4.0 to 46.4 gwei, 11.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.2 gwei
* 9.5k ETH net issuance this week
9.5k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $3,288 - $3,666, currently $3,598, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $3,288 - $3,666, currently $3,598, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.037 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.037 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
* Dan Finlay: meme token experiment , tools & incentives not currently sufficient for
fundraising or having fun
Dan Finlay: meme token experiment , tools & incentives not currently sufficient for
* Kraken NFT marketplace closing , users have 3 months to withdraw NFTs
Kraken NFT marketplace closing , users have 3 months to withdraw NFTs
* Freysa : player successfully convinced AI agent to transfer prize pool
Freysa : player successfully convinced AI agent to transfer prize pool
Regulation/business/tokens
* US Fifth Circuit rules Tornado Cash immutable contracts canâ€™t be sanctioned under
current law, OFAC overstepped
US Fifth Circuit rules Tornado Cash immutable contracts canâ€™t be sanctioned under
* Coinbase USDC Rewards sunset in Europe due to MiCA regulation
Coinbase USDC Rewards sunset in Europe due to MiCA regulation
General
* EF Poseidon cryptanalysis initiative : attack bounties & research grants
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-november-30-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Dec 4-5 â€“ Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop (New York)

* Dec 6-8 â€“ ETHIndia hackathon
Dec 6-8 â€“ ETHIndia hackathon
* Dec 9 â€“ EF internships 2025 application deadline
Dec 9 â€“ EF internships 2025 application deadline
* Jan 20 â€“ Ethereum protocol attackathon ends
Jan 20 â€“ Ethereum protocol attackathon ends
